channel.title: Problems connecting through no-ip
channel.description:
I have followed many tutorials and it appears I have done everything correct.
My problem is that it doesn't seem to want to connect to my No-ip address. I can play under 127.0.0.1 but not under my no-ip. (Note: That I have run a server before on this same computer, but it was about 1 year ago.)
When trying to connect to my server under the no-ip I get the basic error message.
[ul][b]What I have done:[/b]
[list][li] Ports are open [img]http://www.freewebs.com/giggles-psobb/portopen.PNG[/img][/li]
[li] Correct Classpath and Path [img]http://www.freewebs.com/giggles-psobb/classpath.PNG[/img][/li]
[li] Correct Ip under client[/li] [li] No-ip running[/li] [li] Allowed my router to allow other ip address's to pass through[/li] [li] Firewalls off[/li] [li] Tested under 3 different computers[/li] [/list]
[b]Edit: More Info[/b] My OS is Windows Xp, and I use SP2
I'd appreciate help! Thank You![/ul]

item.title: Problems connecting through no-ip
item.dc:creator: @Mr_GigGles Mr GigGles
item.description:
@Mr_GigGles wrote:

360236:

I don’t think your computer can connect to No-IP just other people. But I don’t no, that is just how it is for me.

Ok

Well I tried to connect to my normal Ip, but I still get a error message. [br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 11, 2009, 09:20:08 pm[/size][hr]Well, I am still having problems. Anyone out there no what may be wrong?

item.title: Problems connecting through no-ip
item.dc:creator: @Mr_GigGles Mr GigGles
item.description:
@Mr_GigGles wrote:

I have followed many tutorials and it appears I have done everything correct.

My problem is that it doesn’t seem to want to connect to my No-ip address. I can play under 127.0.0.1 but not under my no-ip. (Note: That I have run a server before on this same computer, but it was about 1 year ago.)

When trying to connect to my server under the no-ip I get the basic error message.

[ul]What I have done:

[list][li] Ports are open
[/li]

[li] Correct Classpath and Path
[/li]

[li] Correct Ip under client[/li]
[li] No-ip running[/li]
[li] Allowed my router to allow other ip address’s to pass through[/li]
[li] Firewalls off[/li]
[li] Tested under 3 different computers[/li]
[/list]

Edit: More Info
My OS is Windows Xp, and I use SP2

I’d appreciate help! Thank You![/ul]
